location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File No. 7/6 Import duties at Uqair, Qatif and Jubail'

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in chronological order.

Foliation: The foliation sequence commences at the front cover and terminates at the back cover; these numbers are written in pencil, and can be found in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. Foliation errors: 1, 1A, 1B and 1C.

mods.abstract: This file contains correspondence between Captain Charles Geoffrey Prior, Political Agent at Bahrain; Lieutenant-Colonel Cyril Charles Johnson Barrett, Political Resident in the Persian Gulf at Bushire; and Yusuf bin Ahmed Kanoo [Yūsuf bin Aḥmad Kānū].These papers concern an enquiry by telegraph on 7 August 1929 by the Political Resident about the rates of import duties charged by ‘Abd al-‘Azīz bin ‘Abd al-Raḥmān bin Fayṣal Āl Sa‘ūd (Ibn Sa‘ūd) at the Eastern Arabian ports of Uqair [al-‘Uqayr], Qatif [al-Qaṭīf] and Jubail [al-Jubayl] (f. 1C). Lists of tariffs on various imports, including rice, wheat, ghee, coffee and sugar, are given in a letter from Kanoo (f. 2) and in correspondence from the Political Agent to the Political Resident (f. 4).
